Wewant toknow a velocity function,  $v(t)$  .Weknowtwothings: 
1.The acceleration,i.e.,  $v^{\prime}(t)=-32$  ,and 2.thevelocity at a specific time,i.e.,  $v(3)=-10$  
Using the first piece of information, we know that  $v(t)$  isan antiderivative of  $v^{\prime}(t)=-32$  .Sowe begin by finding the indefiniteintegralof  $-32$  

$$
\int(-32)\;d t=-32t+C=v(t).
$$
 
Nowweuse thefactthat  $v(3)=-10$  to find  $C$  

$$
\begin{array}{c}{v(t)=-32t+C}\\ {v(3)=-10}\\ {-32(3)+C=-10}\\ {C=86}\end{array}
$$
